intro: Odontarrhena decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive odontarrhena, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are often mistaken for other species due to its deceptive appearance. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough texture, while the stems are often hairy. Odontarrhena decipiens is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
